metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7062 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In PHP versions 7.2.x below 7.2.28, 7.3.x below 7.3.15 and 7.4.x below 7.4.3, when using file upload functionality, if upload progress tracking is enabled, but session.upload_progress.cleanup is set to 0 (disabled), and the file upload fails, the upload procedure would try to clean up data that does not exist and encounter null pointer dereference, which would likely lead to a crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7062` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.2 - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libphp7.2-embed - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
php7.2 - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
php7.2-bcmath - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.4

criterions.comment: php7.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.4').
